Name.BusinessNameLine1: American Association of Professional Landmen Inc

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: AAPL's mission is to promote the highest standards of performance for all land professionals, to advance their stature, and to encourage sound stewardship of energy and mineral resources.
IRS990.MissionDescription: AAPL's mission is to promote the highest standards of performance for all land professionals, to advance their stature, and to encourage sound stewardship of energy and mineral resources.
IRS990.Description: AAPL is an organization representing men and women engaged in petroleum and mineral land matters. Its purposes are carried out by a monthly magazine/journal with a distribution of approximately 12,000 copies. Purposes are also carried out through educational seminars, quarterly board meetings and an annual meeting/conference. AAPL has over 10,000 members.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Schedule D, Part X, Line 2: On July 1, 2009, the organization adopted the provisions of FASB ASC 740, Income Taxes, which requires financial statement recognition and disclosure for uncertain tax positions taken or expected to be taken in a tax return. Financial statement recognition of a tax position is dependent on an assessment of a 50% or greater likelihood that the tax position will be sustained upon examination by the Internal Revenue Service, based on the technical merits of the position. Interest and penalties, if any, related to uncertain tax positions would be recorded in the statement of activities as general and administrative expense. Upon adoption (July 1, 2009) and as of June 30, 2010, management determined that the organization does not have any unrecognized tax benefits. With few exceptions, federal income tax returns are no longer subject to examination by tax authorities prior to 2007.

Disregarded LLC revenue: 17561. Rent Expense Reported as Negative Rental Income: 125899. Grant Expense Reported as Negative Contribution Income: 100000. Book/Tax adjustment in partnership investment: 1460. Transfered assets to affiliates: 23851.
Disregarded LLC expenses: 17561. Rent Expense Reported as Negative Rental Income: 125899. Grant Expense Reported as Negative Contribution Income: 100000. Transfered Assets to Affiliates: 23851.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrant: For Support of Education Foundation grants and assistance

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: GRANTS ARE GIVEN TO OUR RELATED ORGANIZATION, THE LANDMAN SCHOLARSHIP TRUST, FOR USE ACCORDING TO ITS CHARTER (AWARDING SCHOLARSHIPS TO DESERVING STUDENTS ACCORDING TO CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY THE LANDMAN SCHOLARSHIP TRUST). AMERICAN ASSOCIATION OF PROFESSIONAL LANDMEN DOES NOT OTHERWISE MONITOR THE USE OF THE FUNDS; HOWEVER, THE LANDMAN SCHOLARSHIP TRUST AUDIT REPORT IS INCLUDED WITH THE AAPL AUDIT AND IS DISTRIBUTED TO THE AAPL BOARD.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: Travel valued at $1,971 was provided for the wife of the Executive VP, Robin Forte. AAPL also pays $131 per month for his membership in the Petroleum Club.

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.Relationship: Rosprim is on the Board of Directors of Related Organization

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: All new applicants for Active Member status on or after June 1, 1993, shall be required to meet the following minimum objective standards: I. Practicing land professional. The applicant shall be a land professional with a 4-year college degree or four or more years of continuous engagement as a Land Professional. II. Sponsorship. The application must be sponsored by two Active Members of AAPL. III. Employment classification. The applicant shall be classified either as an "exempt" employee by the applicant's employer or as an independent contractor. IV. Ethical conduct and standards of practice. The applicant must execute such documentation as AAPL may require affirming the applicant's willingness to be bound by and abide within the AAPL Code of Ethics and Standards of Practice. Three non-voting memberships are also available: Associate Member, Student Member, and Honorary Member.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Only Active Members may vote in the affairs of the AAPL, sponsor membership applications, or serve as a director of the AAPL. The election of officers shall be by ballot of the voting members. Records are maintained at the international headquarters to determine the voting eligibility of any member. Each Active Member of the AAPL shall be entitled to one vote.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7b
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The election of officers shall be by ballot of the voting members.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A copy of Form 990 was provided to the Executive board for review prior to submitting it to the IRS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Performance and pay are reviewed annually by the compensation committee in December and a recommendation to the executive committee is made which is reviewed and then approved. Salary surveys of non-profit associations are used for comparison, records are kept of the process and results. Line 15b: Performance and pay are reviewed annually by the executive vice-president in December of each year for other key employees.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Governing documents, the AAPL Bylaws, Starndards of Practice and the AAPL Certification Program, are published annually in the Landman's Directory. The directory is mailed to all paid members.
There have been no significant changes from prior year.

NAPE Expo LP is an arrangement that is similar to a joint venture. NAPE's only activity is a trade show which is an exempt activity under IRC Section 513. All partners in NAPE Expo LP are tax exempt organizations.

Form990ScheduleRPartII.PrimaryActivities: Grants to public charities to benefit U.S. wounded veterans & families
